Claudius was sent back to his province, and recovered the colony in the following year (ac. 176). The same summer witnessed a victory of the consul Petillius over the Ligurians, in which Petillius himself was killed. In 175 the consul M. He repeated these outrages in the following year while the consuls delayed to supersede him.
